actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 20 to 10 years the period of time that a divorced woman's marriage to an individual must have lasted for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on the basis of the wages and self-employment income of such individual.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Reduces from 20 to 10 years the period of time under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors', and Disability Insurance) that a divorced woman's marriage to an individual must have lasted for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on the basis of the wages and self-employment income of such individual.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce from 20 to 10 years the period of time that a divorced woman's marriage to an individual must have lasted for her to qualify for wife's or widow's benefits on the basis of the wages and self-employment income of such individual.
